name: R. Aidan Campbell
body:
## Projects In Progress

### World Light Map
My personal make of a light map project seen [here](http://www.reddit.com/r/DIY/comments/29fhna/abstract_world_map_wall_art_project/) and [here](http://www.reddit.com/r/arduino/comments/2cp83q/i_made_a_an_abstract_world_map_art_project_with/).  It uses an ATMega 168 to PWM 12 LED strips, to render the solar terminator as a non-binary but vertical line.

***

## Completed Projects

### [Bastille](https://github.com/raidancampbell/Bastille)
Resolves CWRU's entire IP block, and parses out the MAC addresses from the default hostnames.  This was an interesting project where I actually began to play with multithreading.  Unfortunately, I later found out that multithreading provided little performance increase, as the DNS server was rate-limiting my queries.

### TV-B-Gone Rework
A complete rework of [LadyAda's TV-B-Gone](http://www.adafruit.com/product/73), designed to be smaller, brighter, and have a longer battery life.  This was my first foray into low-level electronics, and I learned how to play with Atmel's ATTiny85-series microcontroller.  A three-part writeup can be seen [here](http://electric-satisfaction.blogspot.com/2012/05/tv-b-gone-redesign-part-i-overview.html), [here](http://electric-satisfaction.blogspot.com/2012/05/tv-b-gone-redesign-part-ii-design.html), and [here](http://electric-satisfaction.blogspot.com/2012/05/tv-b-gone-redesign-part-ii-design.html)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
